title: Airplane Departure

nouns: The act of checking in at a hotel, airport etc
Check-in is the process whereby a person announces their arrival at a hotel, airport or sea port, and by analogy on a social network service.
Airport, sea port or social network service
Act of checking in.
Process whereby a person announces their arrival at a hotel, airport or sea port
The act of reporting your presence (as at an airport or a hotel)
The act of departing.
The act of departing
The act of departing or something that has departed.
An aerodrome or airdrome is a location from which aircraft flight operations take place, regardless of whether they involve cargo, passengers, or neither.
A facility for transporting passengers and/or cargo via aircraft
An airfield equipped with control tower and hangars as well as accommodations for passengers and cargo.
An airfield (a place where airplanes can take off and land), including one or more runways and one or more passenger terminals.
An airfield equipped with control tower and hangars as well as accommodations for passengers and cargo
A place designated for airplanes.
Location from which aircraft flight operations take place (broader than the term airport)
Any place at which flight operations take place. In British English, it refers chiefly to a small airport or airfield
An airfield equipped with air traffic control facilities and hangars as well as accommodation for passengers and cargo; an airport.
An airport served by jet aircraft
A landing and taking-off area for civil aircraft, usually with surfaced runways and aircraft maintenance and passenger facilities.
An airport is a location with facilities for commercial aviation flights to take off and land.
The end of a flight
Last part of a flight
The act of coming down to the earth (or other surface)
Landing is the last part of a flight, where a flying animal, aircraft, or spacecraft returns to the ground.
A place on a shoreline where a boat lands.
The level part of a staircase, at the top of a flight of stairs, or connecting one flight with another.
A vehicle capable of atmospheric flight due to interaction with the air, such as buoyancy or lift.
Machine capable of atmospheric flight.
Machine that is able to fly by gaining support from the air
A vehicle, designed to be supported by the air, either by the dynamic action of the air upon the surfaces of the structure or object or by its own buoyancy.
A vehicle that can fly
An aircraft is a machine that is able to fly by gaining support from the air, or, in general, the atmosphere of a planet.
An aircraft that has a fixed wing and is powered by propellers or jets
A powered heavier-than-air aircraft with fixed wings.
An airplane or aeroplane is a powered, fixed-wing aircraft that is propelled forward by thrust from a jet engine or propeller.
A powered heavier-than-air aircraft with fixed wings that obtains lift by the Bernoulli effect and is used for transportation.
Powered aircraft capable of flight using fixed wings that generate lift
An airplane; an aeroplane.
A formation of aircraft in flight
A formation of aircraft in flight.

description: A plane taking off from a runway. Generally displayed left-right, with the front of the plane elevated.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the airplane departure emoji depicts a sleek, modern aircraft soaring upwards against a backdrop that suggests movement and transition, thanks to Appleâ€™s signature soft gradients. The airplane itself gleams with realistic lighting and subtle 3D shading, its wings angled for flight, symbolizing travel, journeys beginning, and moving on. This emoji on Apple devices is perfect for expressing excitement about upcoming trips or the start of a new adventure.
